intro: Spermacoce valens, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce valens is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in some areas.
